author: J0rgen
title: Fifty points if it goes through her head!
review:
I've wanted a Moaning Myrtle since Chamber of Secrets was released in 2002, and this fig is definitively worth the wait! Myrtle has two different faces, both perfectly representing Myrtle's typical moods; one is upset and crying, while the other has a very angry frown. Her skin tone is not white, like Nearly Headless Nick in 75954 Hogwarts Great Hall, but a light blue that almost looks like it's glowing. Her hairpiece is a new mould, perfectly representing the character's hair onscreen. The hairpiece is dark blue, continuing the bluish hue of her skin, cemented by the sand blue, old-fashioned Hogwarts uniform she is wearing. Her accessories are a transparent stand to make her "fly", like the ones from the DC CMF series, and an unharmed version of Tom Riddle's diary, matching the destroyed version included with the Dobby CMF back in 2018. The diary has a printed tile inside, featuring the first words of Harry's interaction with Tom Riddle's memory.

Moaning Myrtle has been among the most wanted Harry Potter characters for years, and this minifigure certainly delivers in every way: Great prints, a new mould, and the perfect accessory. The only drawback is the price, but with a fig this great, it's almost worth it.
